Event.name: Losing_track_of_perceiver
Event.definition: <def-root>This frames describes a <fen>Theme</fen> who evades the sight of a <fen>Perceiver</fen>. The focus of this frame is the <fen>Theme</fen>, which appears in subject position. This frame contrasts with the opposing perspective in Losing_track_of_theme, where the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is the subject and the <fen>Theme</fen> is the object. <ex><fex name="Theme">The burglar</fex> <t>lost</t> <fex name="Perceiver">the police</fex> <fex name="Explanation">as the thief turned the corner</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that becomes unperceivable.</def-root>

Arg.name: Perceiver
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Perceiver</fen> is the entity who fails to keep the <fen>Theme</fen> in sight.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Perceiver</fen> loses perception of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Perceiver</fen> loses perception of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a proposition from which the loss of perception logically follows.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: lose.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to evade the vision of (someone)
